question: How to control signal reflections in bidirectional high-speed communication?
options: Reduce the signal reflection amplitude by reducing the driving intensity and increase the isolation distance of the reverse channel
Symmetry difference distribution line structure is adopted, and additional coupling capacitors are introduced to cancel the reflection
Add a buffer to the receiving end and extend the trace to eliminate reflective effects
Add terminal matching resistors to control the wiring impedance and avoid stubs and too many vias
None of the above options are correct
